creator: david.pascuzzi@new-era-of-networks.com
text:
I am trying to send multiple machines errors to the NT Event Log using a  
socket appender to a NT Event Log appender. I am specifying a  layout and the 
NT event log appender does not seem to be using it.  ( I have the lcf for each 
machine and a over all properties file) No matter what I set the message gets 
the same format. It also would be nice to be able to have the Appenders put the 
machine name of the machine that originated the Log message in the log


log4j.debug=false
log4j.appender.A1=org.apache.log4j.nt.NTEventLogAppender
log4j.appender.A1.Source=OpenBiz
#log4j.appender.A1.layout=org.apache.log4j.TTCCLayout
log4j.appender.A1.layout=org.log4j.PatternLayout
#log4j.appender.A1.layout.ConversionPattern=%d p=%-5p t=[%t] c=%-17c{2} C=%C  
F:L=(%13F:%L) d=%d l=%l M=%M r=%r x=%3x - m=%m\n
log4j.appender.A1.layout.ConversionPattern=MyMachine Date[%d] Priority[%-5p] 
thread[%t] [%-17c{2}] [%l] [%M] [%r] [%x] \n\t<%m>\n

log4j.rootCategory=warn, A1
This is not a bug. It's the way NTEventLogAppender works.
